newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's real drops 0.07 pct in listless trade.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's real drops 0.07 pct in listless trade.

text.p: Brazil's real dropped 0.07 percent to close at 1.0493 per dollar in the commercial foreign exchange market in listless trade ahead of Monday's President's Day holiday in the United States, dealers said.
The real's fall was due to players buying dollars today because Monday's holiday meant they would have no carry-over cost to hold greenbacks over the weekend, they added.
Because of the holiday, today's transactions will be settled on Wednesday, together with Monday's transactions, they added.
In the floating exchange rate market, the real dropped 0.05 percent to close at 1.0547 per dollar.
In the illegal parallel market, the real fell 0.19 percent to end at 1.077 per greenback, traders said.
